intro: Grammitis pseudolocellata, commonly known as the slender spore moss, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rock surfaces or in tropical rainforests. Its reproductive structures, called sporangia, are clustered in small, round clusters called locellae, which are a distinctive feature of the genus. Grammitis pseudolocellata plays an important ecological role in maintaining the microhabitat of its native environments.
